chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You pick cherries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws.
humanum_full_description_en:
"Shuowen": "Pick and squeeze. From the wood to the claw."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the nouns for the time period. "Da Cai" is the time when the day is first released, and "Xiao Cai" is the time of sunset. The inscriptions on gold mean the benevolence, and the Chinese tripod: "Zhu (made) is the benevolence", which means to be your benefactor. "Han Shi Wai Zhuan": "The emperor of the ancients was named by the princes, which is called the mining land." Also used as a name.
humanum_short_description_en: A bronze inscription from the " claw " from the " wood ", Oracle or from the " wood from the" " fruit ", as hand picking fruit on the tree's shape. " Cai " is the original text of " Cai ", the original meaning is to pick.
